Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the extent of the danger by stating that teenagers are participating in a "dangerous" new internet craze, without providing sufficient evidence to support this claim.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to establish a direct connection between the shooting incident and the "No Lackin Challenge" fad. The initial local reports did not reference any connection to the challenge, and it is only later that the challenge is mentioned in relation to the incident.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the shooting incident is a direct result of the "No Lackin Challenge" without providing enough evidence to support this assumption. It is possible that the shooting was an accident unrelated to the challenge.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for the shooting incident, such as negligence or mishandling of the firearm, that are not explored in the claim.
